title: Meyers–Serrin theorem
summary: In functional analysis the Meyers–Serrin theorem, named after James Serrin and Norman George Meyers, states that smooth functions are dense in the Sobolev space W k , p ( Ω ) {\displaystyle W^{k,p}(\Omega )} for arbitrary domains Ω ⊆ R n {\displaystyle \Omega \subseteq \mathbb {R} ^{n}} .
